screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T17:14:14.000Z ##

Apache HTTP security advisory: Apache HTTP Server 2.4 vulnerabilities
8 vulnerabilities fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.60:

  • CVE-2024-36387 DoS by Null pointer in websocket over HTTP/2
  • CVE-2024-38472 Apache HTTP Server on WIndows UNC SSRF
  • CVE-2024-38473 Apache HTTP Server proxy encoding problem (to authentication bypass)
  • CVE-2024-38474 Apache HTTP Server weakness with encoded question marks in backreferences
  • CVE-2024-38475 Apache HTTP Server weakness in mod_rewrite when first segment of substitution matches filesystem path.
  • CVE-2024-38476 Apache HTTP Server may use exploitable/malicious backend application output to run local handlers via internal redirect
  • CVE-2024-38477 Apache HTTP Server: Crash resulting in Denial of Service in mod_proxy via a malicious request
  • CVE-2024-39573 Apache HTTP Server: mod_rewrite proxy handler substitution

shoutout to @orange of DEVCORE for the latter 7 CVEs. No mention of exploitation

#apache #httpd #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-38477(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T21:31:15

2 posts

null pointer dereference in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to crash the server via a malicious request. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T17:14:14.026Z ##

Apache HTTP security advisory: Apache HTTP Server 2.4 vulnerabilities
8 vulnerabilities fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.60:

  • CVE-2024-36387 DoS by Null pointer in websocket over HTTP/2
  • CVE-2024-38472 Apache HTTP Server on WIndows UNC SSRF
  • CVE-2024-38473 Apache HTTP Server proxy encoding problem (to authentication bypass)
  • CVE-2024-38474 Apache HTTP Server weakness with encoded question marks in backreferences
  • CVE-2024-38475 Apache HTTP Server weakness in mod_rewrite when first segment of substitution matches filesystem path.
  • CVE-2024-38476 Apache HTTP Server may use exploitable/malicious backend application output to run local handlers via internal redirect
  • CVE-2024-38477 Apache HTTP Server: Crash resulting in Denial of Service in mod_proxy via a malicious request
  • CVE-2024-39573 Apache HTTP Server: mod_rewrite proxy handler substitution

shoutout to @orange of DEVCORE for the latter 7 CVEs. No mention of exploitation

CVE-2024-38474(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T21:31:15

2 posts

Substitution encoding issue in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows attacker to execute scripts in directories permitted by the configuration but not directly reachable by any URL or source disclosure of scripts meant to only to be executed as CGI. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue. Some RewriteRules that capture and substitute unsa

CVE-2024-38475(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T21:31:15

2 posts

Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure. Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the su

##

CVE-2024-38473(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T21:31:15

2 posts

Encoding problem in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows request URLs with incorrect encoding to be sent to backend services, potentially bypassing authentication via crafted requests. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T17:14:14.026Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38477 Apache HTTP Server: Crash resulting in Denial of Service in mod_proxy via a malicious request

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T20:34:51

2 posts

### Summary Multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. ### Details The GeoTools library API that GeoServer calls evaluates property/attribute names for feature types in a way that unsafely passes them to the common

jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-06-30T21:29:19.000Z ##

Okay it is the end of the month so I need to work on #geoserver CVE-2024-36401 Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in evaulting property name expressessions

This has been our first real test of the security policywith a critical vulnerability. I am interested in feedback on the communication pathways.

Q: How did you learn about this?
Q: Were you able to update your system before vulnerability disclosure today?

CVE-2024-36982
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.109 and 9.1.2308.207, an attacker could trigger a null pointer reference on the cluster/config REST endpoint, which could result in a crash of the Splunk daemon.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in “cluster/config” REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

##

CVE-2024-36997
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312, an admin user could store and execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the browser context of another Splunk user through the conf-web/settings REST endpoint. This could potentially cause a persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) exploit.

CVE-2024-36993
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.200 and 9.1.2308.207, a low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could craft a malicious payload through a Splunk Web Bulletin Messages that could result in execution of unauthorized JavaScript code in the browser of a user.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin

  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

##

CVE-2024-36984
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 on Windows, an authenticated user could execute a specially crafted query that they could then use to serialize untrusted data. The attacker could use the query to execute arbitrary code.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component

(8.8 HIGH)

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

CVE-2024-36983
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.109 and 9.1.2308.207, an authenticated user could create an external lookup that calls a legacy internal function. The authenticated user could use this internal function to insert code into the Splunk platform installation directory. From there, the user could execute arbitrary code on t

  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

CVE-2024-36991
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise on Windows versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10, an attacker could perform a path traversal on the /modules/messaging/ endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows. This vulnerability should only affect Splunk Enterprise on Windows.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in “cluster/config” REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

##

CVE-2024-36996
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.109, an attacker could determine whether or not another user exists on the instance by deciphering the error response that they would likely receive from the instance when they attempt to log in. This disclosure could then lead to additional brute-force password-guessing attacks. This vul

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in “cluster/config” REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

CVE-2024-36992
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:48

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.1.2312.200 and 9.1.2308.207, a low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could craft a malicious payload through a View that could result in execution of unauthorized JavaScript code in the browser of a user. The “url” parameter of the Dashboard element does not have

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in “cluster/config” REST endpoint

##

CVE-2024-20399
(6.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:47

24 posts

A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argum

1 repos

https://github.com/Blootus/CVE-2024-20399-Cisco-RCE

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T14:37:38.119Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 to the KEV Catalog!
See parent toots above for security advisory, Sygnia threat intelligence information, etc.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

#zeroday #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #cisa #cisco #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20399 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T12:32:08.263Z ##

Sygnia: China-Nexus Threat Group ‘Velvet Ant’ Exploits Cisco Zero-Day (CVE-2024-20399) to Compromise Nexus Switch Devices – Advisory for Mitigation and Response

Sygnia identified that CVE-2024-20399 was exploited in the wild by a China-nexus threat group as a ‘zero-day’ and shared the details of the vulnerability with Cisco. By exploiting this vulnerability, a threat group – dubbed ‘Velvet Ant’ – successfully executed commands on the underlying operating system of Cisco Nexus devices. This exploitation led to the execution of a previously unknown custom malware that allowed the threat group to remotely connect to compromised Cisco Nexus devices, upload additional files, and execute code on the devices.

See parent toot above for the Cisco security advisory. cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

#CVE_2024_20399 #eitw #activeexploitation #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE #Cisco

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T17:14:04.825Z ##

just in time to celebrate infosec.exchange returning, Cisco zero day: Cisco NX-OS Software CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of an affected configuration CLI command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of root. Note: To successfully exploit this vulnerability on a Cisco NX-OS device, an attacker must have Administrator credentials.

In April 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

EDIT: Sygnia links attempted zero-day exploitation to Chinese state-sponsored threat actor it tracks as Velvet Ant (no article yet). See related Bleeping Computer reporting; Cisco warns of NX-OS zero-day exploited to deploy custom malware

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_20399 #vulnerability #zeroday #cisco #cve #eitw #cyberespionage #velvetant #china

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T14:37:38.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 to the KEV Catalog!
See parent toots above for security advisory, Sygnia threat intelligence information, etc.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart @jerry

By exploiting this vulnerability, a threat group – dubbed ‘Velvet Ant’ – successfully executed commands on the underlying operating system of Cisco Nexus devices. This exploitation led to the execution of a previously unknown custom malware that allowed the threat group to remotely connect to compromised Cisco Nexus devices, upload additional files, and execute code on the devices.

CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T17:14:04.000Z ##

just in time to celebrate infosec.exchange returning, Cisco zero day: Cisco NX-OS Software CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20399 (6.0 medium) A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of an affected configuration CLI command. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of root. Note: To successfully exploit this vulnerability on a Cisco NX-OS device, an attacker must have Administrator credentials.

EDIT: Sygnia links attempted zero-day exploitation to Chinese state-sponsored threat actor it tracks as Velvet Ant (no article yet). See related Bleeping Computer reporting; Cisco warns of NX-OS zero-day exploited to deploy custom malware

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_20399 #vulnerability #zeroday #cisco #cve #eitw #cyberespionage #velvetant #china

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T14:50:34.180Z ##

@jerry @campuscodi @briankrebs @cR0w @mttaggart https://www.sygnia.co/threat-reports-and-advisories/china-nexus-threat-group-velvet-ant-exploits-cisco-0-day/

CVE-2024-20399 that was identified by Sygnia allows an attacker with valid administrator credentials to the Switch management console to escape the NX-OS CLI and execute arbitrary commands on the Linux underlaying operating system.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisco-warns-of-nx-os-zero-day-exploited-to-deploy-custom-malware/

"The threat actors gathered administrator-level credentials to gain access to Cisco Nexus switches and deploy a previously unknown custom malware that allowed them to remotely connect to compromised devices, upload additional files and execute malicious code."

Post-compromise activity includes persistence for sure, but extended beyond that.

##
AAKL at 2024-07-02T14:21:38.576Z ##

jbhall56 at 2024-07-02T11:53:55.742Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20399 (CVSS score of 6), the security defect impacts the command line interface of NX-OS and could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system, with root privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisco-patches-nx-os-zero-day-exploited-by-chinese-cyberspies/

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T13:56:30.000Z ##

- - KEV catalogue listing: #Cisco NX-OS Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20399 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-20399

- Seven Industrial Control Systems Advisories https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/07/02/cisa-releases-seven-industrial-control-systems-advisories

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T11:53:55.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20399 (CVSS score of 6), the security defect impacts the command line interface of NX-OS and could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system, with root privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisco-patches-nx-os-zero-day-exploited-by-chinese-cyberspies/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:19:14.000Z ##

@kpwn CVE Crowd showing a major community interest in CVE-2024-6387 #regreSSHion even though CVE-2024-20399 is a newly discovered Cisco zero-day linked to a Chinese state-sponsored actor #cvecrowddeny

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T17:43:36.000Z ##

@jerry Cisco zero-day CVE-2024-20399 dropped at 12pm while infosec.exchange was down: https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-nxos-cmd-injection-xD9OhyOP

EDIT: Sygnia links attempted zero-day exploitation to Chinese state-sponsored threat actor it tracks as Velvet Ant (no article yet). See related Bleeping Computer reporting; Cisco warns of NX-OS zero-day exploited to deploy custom malware

##

CVE-2024-36990
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-01T18:32:41

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.2.2403.100, an authenticated, low-privileged user that does not hold the admin or power Splunk roles could send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to the datamodel/web REST endpoint in Splunk Enterprise, potentially causing a denial of service.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:32:48.711Z ##

Do you like Splunk? Do you like them enough to read 18* security advisories?

  1. SVD-2024-0701 Missing CVE ID (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through dashboard PDF generation component
  2. SVD-2024-0702 CVE-2024-36982 (7.5 high) Denial of Service through null pointer reference in “cluster/config” REST endpoint
  3. SVD-2024-0703 CVE-2024-36983 (8.0 high) Command Injection using External Lookups
  4. SVD-2024-0704 CVE-2024-36984 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution through Serialized Session Payload in Splunk Enterprise on Windows
  5. SVD-2024-0705 CVE-2024-36985 (8.8 high) Remote Code Execution (RCE) through an external lookup due to "copybuckets.py" script in the "splunk_archiver" application in Splunk Enterprise
  6. SVD-2024-0706 CVE-2024-36986 (6.3 medium) Risky command safeguards bypass through Search ID query in Analytics Workspace
  7. SVD-2024-0707 CVE-2024-36987 (4.3 medium) Insecure File Upload in the indexing/preview REST endpoint
  8. SVD-2024-0708 No CVE ID, informational only: OpenSSL crypto library (libcrypto.so) incorrectly compiled with stack execution bit set in Splunk Enterprise and Universal Forwarder on certain operating systems
  9. SVD-2024-0709 CVE-2024-36989 (6.5 medium) Low-privileged user could create notifications in Splunk Web Bulletin Messages
  10. SVD-2024-0710 CVE-2024-36990 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) on the datamodel/web REST endpoint
  11. SVD-2024-0711 CVE-2024-36991 (7.5 high) Path Traversal on the "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows (cc: @reverseics)
  12. SVD-2024-0712 CVE-2024-36992 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  13. SVD-2024-0713 CVE-2024-36993 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Web Bulletin
  14. SVD-2024-0714 CVE-2024-36994 (5.4 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in Dashboard Elements
  15. SVD-2024-0715 CVE-2024-36995 (4.3 medium) Low-privileged user could create experimental items
  16. SVD-2024-0716 CVE-2024-36996 (5.3 medium) Information Disclosure of user names
  17. SVD-2024-0717 CVE-2024-36997 (4.6 medium) Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in conf-web/settings REST endpoint
  18. SVD-2024-0718 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - July 2024 (23 vulnerabilities, unknown exploitation and CVSS score statuses)

No mention of exploitation. h/t for @cR0w for the last 2 CVE IDs (I relied specifically on the RSS feed entries).

##

CVE-2024-21461
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-07-01T15:32:43

4 posts

Memory corruption while performing finish HMAC operation when context is freed by keymaster.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T16:46:05.481Z ##

Qualcomm security advisory: July 2024 Security Bulletin
I mentioned Qualcomm yesterday in the Android security advisory toot, here's their July 2024 security bulletin. The critical rated CVE-2024-21461 is a CVSSv3.1 8.4 high severity vulnerability in reality: Double Free in HLOS, Memory corruption while performing finish HMAC operation when context is freed by keymaster. 6 vulnerabilities of varying severities. No mention of exploitation

#qualcomm #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.760Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—July 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-5535(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-29T06:31:39

5 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

1 repos

#search_error

david_chisnall at 2024-06-29T08:58:47.614Z ##

This week’s exciting instalment of information-disclosure-over-the-network vulnerabilities that would have been deterministically mitigated by CHERI is brought to you by OpenSSL.

##
wezm@mastodon.decentralised.social at 2024-06-27T23:39:58.000Z ##

CVE-2024-5535: OpenSSL`SSL_select_next_proto` buffer overread:
Silently sends up to 255 bytes of the client’s heap to the server.

> **2024-04-23** - Discovery of `SSL_select_next_proto` memory unsafety while rewriting it in rust.

https://jbp.io/2024/06/27/cve-2024-5535-openssl-memory-safety.html #rust #RustLang

##
cadey@pony.social at 2024-06-27T18:13:53.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-5535/

(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-27T21:32:17

13 posts

An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability in Juniper Networks Session Smart Router or conductor running with a redundant peer allows a network based attacker to bypass authentication and take full control of the device. Only routers or conductors that are running in high-availability redundant configurations are affected by this vulnerability. No other Juniper N

##

CVE-2024-35153
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:38

2 posts

IBM WebSphere Application Server 8.5 and 9.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows a privileged user to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 292640.

AAKL at 2024-07-02T14:57:31.313Z ##

New #IBM security advisories:

- Disabled USB port vulnerability affects IBM FlashSystem 5300 - CVE-2024-39723 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159333

Yikes. 🤦‍♂️

- IBM Observability with Instana (OnPrem) is affected by Multiple Security Vulnerabilities - CVE-2023-43804; CVE-2024-29025; CVE-2023-44487; CVE-2024-23450; CVE-2023-2454; CVE-2023-5072; CVE-2023-39417; CVE-2023-5869; CVE-2023-36478; CVE-2024-0985; CVE-2024-26308; CVE-2024-25710 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7158633

- WebSphere Application Server shipped with IBM Security Guardium Key Lifecycle Manager - CVE-2024-35153 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159502

- IBM PowerVM Novalink: jose4j denial of service vulnerability caused by improper input validation - CVE-2023-51775 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159508

- BM WebSphere Application Server Liberty 17.0.0.3 through 24.0.0.5 are vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection - CVE-2024-2235 https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7159507 #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2024-35260
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:38

3 posts

Microsoft Dataverse Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-27T20:50:38.000Z ##

Microsoft says it will issue CVEs for security issues in its cloud services

https://msrc.microsoft.com/blog/2024/06/toward-greater-transparency-unveiling-cloud-service-cves/

Example CVE: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-35260

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-27T20:50:38.000Z ##

Microsoft says it will issue CVEs for security issues in its cloud services

https://msrc.microsoft.com/blog/2024/06/toward-greater-transparency-unveiling-cloud-service-cves/

Example CVE: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-35260

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T17:58:19.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory: Microsoft Dataverse Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVE-2024-35260 (CVSS:3.1 8.0 high, disclosed 27 June 2024 by Microsoft) was unexpectedly announced today (out-of-band outside of Patch Tuesday). Remarks:

  • The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve
  • Weakness: CWE-426: Untrusted Search Path
  • Why are there no links to an update or instructions with steps that must be taken to protect from this vulnerability?
    This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency. Please see Toward greater transparency: Unveiling Cloud Service CVEs for more information.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation more likely.

#CVE_2024_35260 #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #Dataverse

##

CVE-2024-28820(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:37

2 posts

Buffer overflow in the extract_openvpn_cr function in openvpn-cr.c in openvpn-auth-ldap (aka the Three Rings Auth-LDAP plugin for OpenVPN) 2.0.4 allows attackers with a valid LDAP username and who can control the challenge/response password field to pass a string with more than 14 colons into this field and cause a buffer overflow.

CVE-2024-39458
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T12:47:19.847000

1 posts

When Jenkins Structs Plugin 337.v1b_04ea_4df7c8 and earlier fails to configure a build step, it logs a warning message containing diagnostic information that may contain secrets passed as step parameters, potentially resulting in accidental exposure of secrets through the default system log.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T18:14:20.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-06-26
3 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-39458 (3.1 low) Exposure of secrets through system log in Structs Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39459 (4.3 medium) Secret file credentials stored unencrypted in rare cases by Plain Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39460 (4.3 medium) Bitbucket OAuth access token exposed in the build log by Bitbucket Branch Source Plugin

#Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-39459
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T12:47:19.847000

1 posts

In rare cases Jenkins Plain Credentials Plugin 182.v468b_97b_9dcb_8 and earlier stores secret file credentials unencrypted (only Base64 encoded) on the Jenkins controller file system, where they can be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system (global credentials) or with Item/Extended Read permission (folder-scoped credentials).

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T18:14:20.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-06-26
3 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-39458 (3.1 low) Exposure of secrets through system log in Structs Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39459 (4.3 medium) Secret file credentials stored unencrypted in rare cases by Plain Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39460 (4.3 medium) Bitbucket OAuth access token exposed in the build log by Bitbucket Branch Source Plugin

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-27T12:30:43

2 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

5 repos

https://github.com/kevcooper/CVE-2024-1086-checker

https://github.com/feely666/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

stdevel@chaos.social at 2024-06-28T06:42:54.000Z ##

Im Juni wurden u.a. #NixOS 24.05 und SLES sowie #openSUSE Leap 15 SP6 veröffentlicht. Zabbix erschien in der neuen Version 7.0. Neben zahlreichen Software-Updates wurden auch neue ARM- und RISC-V-Notebooks angekündigt. Der Sovereign Tech Fund startet in eine nächste Förderrunde, während Debian intern über verschiedene Themen diskutiert.

##

CVE-2024-6293(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T03:30:56

2 posts

Use after free in Dawn in Google Chrome prior to 126.0.6478.126 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.726Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has five total Chromium-based security advisories. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome blog post disclosing four of the CVE IDs on 25 June 2024. CVE-2024-6290 through CVE-2024-6293 are included by MSRC (note: MSRC got lazy and didn't include the whole description in the title e.g. "Chromium: CVE-2024-6290 Use after free in Dawn").
The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Interestingly "The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe Software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)." The Common Weakness and Enumeration is CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read. It is marked Not exploited, Not publicly disclosed and Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_34122 #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #Adobe

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has five total Chromium-based security advisories. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome blog post disclosing four of the CVE IDs on 25 June 2024. CVE-2024-6290 through CVE-2024-6293 are included by MSRC (note: MSRC got lazy and didn't include the whole description in the title e.g. "Chromium: CVE-2024-6290 Use after free in Dawn").
The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Interestingly "The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe Software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)." The Common Weakness and Enumeration is CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read. It is marked Not exploited, Not publicly disclosed and Exploitation Less Likely.

##

CVE-2024-6323
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

2 posts

Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-2191
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

2 posts

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 9.2 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, with the processing logic for generating link in dependency files can lead to a regular expression DoS attack on the server

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:10

patchnow24x7@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-28T04:32:59.000Z ##

CVE-2024-5655 :: CVSS Score : 9.6 :: Upgrade your GitLab (Both Enterprise Edition and Community Edition) to the latest version.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

CVE-2024-1816
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:10

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

Date: June 26, 2024

  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]

  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-3959
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High

An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Date: June 26, 2024

CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

Multiple Denial of Service (DoS) conditions has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
