Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-39460
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-26T20:00:06

1 posts

Bitbucket Branch Source Plugin 886.v44cf5e4ecec5 and earlier prints the Bitbucket OAuth access token as part of the Bitbucket URL in the build log in some cases. Bitbucket Branch Source Plugin 887.va_d359b_3d2d8d does not include the Bitbucket OAuth access token as part of the Bitbucket URL in the build log.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T18:14:20.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-06-26
3 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-39458 (3.1 low) Exposure of secrets through system log in Structs Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39459 (4.3 medium) Secret file credentials stored unencrypted in rare cases by Plain Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-39460 (4.3 medium) Bitbucket OAuth access token exposed in the build log by Bitbucket Branch Source Plugin

CVE-2024-27867(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-26T06:30:29

10 posts

An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in AirPods Firmware Update 6A326, AirPods Firmware Update 6F8, and Beats Firmware Update 6F8. When your headphones are seeking a connection request to one of your previously paired devices, an attacker in Bluetooth range might be able to spoof the intended source device and gain access to your headphones.

CVE-2024-5276
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T21:31:24

3 posts

A SQL Injection vulnerability in Fortra FileCatalyst Workflow allows an attacker to modify application data.  Likely impacts include creation of administrative users and deletion or modification of data in the application database. Data exfiltration via SQL injection is not possible using this vulnerability. Successful unauthenticated exploitation requires a Workflow system with anonymous access e

##

CVE-2024-5806
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:18

22 posts

Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.This issue affects MOVEit Transfer: from 2023.0.0 before 2023.0.11, from 2023.1.0 before 2023.1.6, from 2024.0.0 before 2024.0.2.

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/watchTowr-vs-progress-moveit_CVE-2024-5806

catc0n at 2024-07-01T23:44:20.810Z ##

Rapid7 analysis of #MOVEit Transfer #CVE_2024_5806 c/o @stephenfewer, with an assist from @fuzz. Notably, this exploit method is different from the one published last week — Rapid7's exploit achieves the auth bypass by manipulating the username supplied client-side during the SSH protocol's public key auth exchange with the server. As a result, both exploitability and IOCs are different. This also doesn't rely on what appears to be a new 0day for exploitation, though that was an interesting (if surprising) method.
https://attackerkb.com/topics/44EZLG2xgL/cve-2024-5806/rapid7-analysis

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.293Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using the MOVEit Cloud environment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_5805 #CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #Moveit #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:21:48.529Z ##

watchTowr: Auth. Bypass In (Un)Limited Scenarios - Progress MOVEit Transfer (CVE-2024-5806)
Hot off the press! cc: @cR0w @mttaggart
CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.
watchTowr provides additional information (and what looks like a proof of concept exploit code) in their deep dive:

The vulnerability arises from the interplay between MOVEit and IPWorks SSH, and a failure to handle an error condition.

Progress quietly emailed MOVEit customers about an "auth bypass in SFTP" around 13 June 2024. Information about CVE-2024-5806 was embargoed until today 25 June 2024.

#CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #vulnerability #CVE

  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)

##
mle@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T15:11:11.000Z ##

As of 7:15 PM ET 6/25, Progress Software updated the CVSS score of CVE-2024-5806 (auth bypass in MOVEit Transfer) from a 7.4 (HIGH) to 9.1 (CRITICAL).

Their advisory now includes reporting on additional "newly identified" vulnerabilities in a third-party component used by MOVEit Transfer. The original patch for CVE-2024-5806 does not mitigate these issues, and Progress urges customers to:

➡️ Block inbound RDP access to MOVEit Transfer
➡️ Limit outbound access to only trusted servers

https://community.progress.com/s/article/MOVEit-Transfer-Product-Security-Alert-Bulletin-June-2024-CVE-2024-5806

#MOVEit #security

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T14:41:00.000Z ##

@cR0w @mttaggart if you can provide some evidence of hands-on-keyboard exploitation attempts, CVE-2024-5806 could be added to CISA's KEV Catalog.

@censys also came to the same assessment: Organizations who were victims to the previous mass exploitation of CVE-2023-34362 are likely the same ones at risk for CVE-2024-5806: https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T12:30:52.000Z ##

The new bug (CVE-2024-5806, CVSS: 7.4) is an improper authentication vulnerability in MOVEit's SFTP module that "can lead to authentication bypass in limited scenarios," according to Progress. https://www.darkreading.com/remote-workforce/fresh-moveit-bug-under-attack-disclosure

##
mle@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T00:00:50.000Z ##

*cracks knuckles*

Okay, here we go.

On June 25, 2024, Progress Software disclosed two auth bypass vulnerabilities in the SFTP module of their #MOVEit software:

✴️ CVE-2024-5806, in MOVEit Transfer (CVSS 7.4)
✴️ CVE-2024-5085, in MOVEit Gateway (CVSS 9.1)

We took this opportunity to examine MOVEit Transfer exposure, roughly one year after Clop began a mass exploitation campaign against the file transfer software.

More details in our blog ⤵️
https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

#CensysResearch #security

##

CVE-2021-4440(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:17

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: x86/xen: Drop USERGS_SYSRET64 paravirt call commit afd30525a659ac0ae0904f0cb4a2ca75522c3123 upstream. USERGS_SYSRET64 is used to return from a syscall via SYSRET, but a Xen PV guest will nevertheless use the IRET hypercall, as there is no sysret PV hypercall defined. So instead of testing all the prerequisites for doing a sysr

1 repos

#search_error

CVE-2023-44487
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 73.19%

updated 2024-06-21T21:34:00

3 posts

## HTTP/2 Rapid reset attack The HTTP/2 protocol allows clients to indicate to the server that a previous stream should be canceled by sending a RST_STREAM frame. The protocol does not require the client and server to coordinate the cancellation in any way, the client may do it unilaterally. The client may also assume that the cancellation will take effect immediately when the server receives the

##
laozhoubuluo@dvd.chat at 2024-07-01T15:42:09.312Z ##

回顾去年，CentOS 7 在一周内发布的三个漏洞中都因为所带组件版本较低不受新版本组件漏洞影响而幸免遇难。

CentOS 7 is the real security hero this week! 💪
✅ cURL too old for CVE-2023-38545
✅ glibc too old for CVE-2023-4911 / Looney Tunables
✅ httpd too old for CVE-2023-44487 or any HTTP/2 support

https://x.com/faker_/status/1712012931381047360

RE: https://dvd.chat/notes/9v6ojfjmqcb212k1

Ollama before 0.1.34 does not validate the format of the digest (sha256 with 64 hex digits) when getting the model path, and thus mishandles the TestGetBlobsPath test cases such as fewer than 64 hex digits, more than 64 hex digits, or an initial `../` substring.

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.79%

updated 2024-06-13T19:34:00

1 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

Nuclei template

11 repos

https://github.com/cmsec423/Magento-XXE-CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2024-34102-CosmicSting-XXE-in-Adobe-Commerce-and-Magento

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/0x0d3ad/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/ArturArz1/TestCVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-34102

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T14:03:42.000Z ##

AssetNote: Why nested deserialization is harmful: Magento XXE (CVE-2024-34102)
AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

AssetNote patch diffed to find the root cause, and provides a walkthrough to crafting a proof of concept exploit.

#CVE_2024_34102 #vulnerability #AdobeCommerce #Magento #CVE

##

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:08

2 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T21:36:30.284Z ##

SonicWall: A Deep Dive Into DarkME Rat Malware
SonicWall provides a technical analysis of DarkME RAT malware. They only mention CVE-2024-21412 once: It is a Microsoft Windows Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVSSv3.1: 8.1 high severity) leveraged by the financially motivated Water Hydra (DarkCasino) APT during a a spike in DarkME RAT distribution in February 2024. While SonicWall describes the infection chain and the RAT's features, they do NOT provide IOC. I'm not going to handjam the SHA256 from a VirusTotal screenshot.

#Darkme #DarkGate #WaterHydra #DarkCasino #APT #malwareanalysis #CVE_2024_21412 #threatintel

##

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:06

2 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

2 repos

https://github.com/invaderslabs/CVE-2024-20666

https://github.com/nnotwen/Script-For-CVE-2024-20666

avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.473Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows “0x80070643 error” introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

#security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-it-support-sites-push-malicious-powershell-scripts-as-windows-fixes/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.000Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows “0x80070643 error” introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T12:26:18.000Z ##

One of the security holes, CVE-2024-31484, is a buffer overread issue that can be exploited to read sensitive data from memory, which can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the current process or to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. https://www.securityweek.com/siemens-sicam-vulnerabilities-could-facilitate-attacks-on-energy-sector/

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

1 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

CVE-2024-5565
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T15:15:52

3 posts

The Vanna library uses a prompt function to present the user with visualized results, it is possible to alter the prompt using prompt injection and run arbitrary Python code instead of the intended visualization code. Specifically - allowing external input to the library’s “ask” method with "visualize" set to True (default behavior) leads to remote code execution.

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-28T00:00:03.000Z ##

｢ Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed a high-severity security flaw in the VannaAI library that could be exploited to achieve remote code execution vulnerability via prompt injection techniques. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5565 (CVSS score: 8.1), relates to a case of prompt injection in the "ask" function that could be exploited to trick the library into executing arbitrary ｣

https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/prompt-injection-flaw-in-vanna-ai.html

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-28T00:00:03.000Z ##

mle@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T00:00:50.000Z ##

*cracks knuckles*

Okay, here we go.

On June 25, 2024, Progress Software disclosed two auth bypass vulnerabilities in the SFTP module of their #MOVEit software:

✴️ CVE-2024-5806, in MOVEit Transfer (CVSS 7.4)
✴️ CVE-2024-5085, in MOVEit Gateway (CVSS 9.1)

We took this opportunity to examine MOVEit Transfer exposure, roughly one year after Clop began a mass exploitation campaign against the file transfer software.

More details in our blog ⤵️
https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

#CensysResearch #security

##

CVE-2024-3833(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-12T05:04:00

4 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.75%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

2 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

4 repos

ckure at 2024-07-02T03:00:00.659Z ##

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

CVE-2023-38545
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2024-04-11T05:04:51

1 posts

This flaw makes curl overflow a heap based buffer in the SOCKS5 proxy handshake. When curl is asked to pass along the host name to the SOCKS5 proxy to allow that to resolve the address instead of it getting done by curl itself, the maximum length that host name can be is 255 bytes. If the host name is detected to be longer, curl switches to local name resolving and instead passes on the resolved

https://github.com/nphuang/NS-Project-2024-Spring

https://github.com/fatmo666/CVE-2023-38545-libcurl-SOCKS5-heap-buffer-overflow

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2023-38545

https://github.com/imfht/CVE-2023-38545

https://github.com/dbrugman/CVE-2023-38545-POC

https://github.com/bcdannyboy/CVE-2023-38545

laozhoubuluo@dvd.chat at 2024-07-01T15:42:09.312Z ##

回顾去年，CentOS 7 在一周内发布的三个漏洞中都因为所带组件版本较低不受新版本组件漏洞影响而幸免遇难。

CentOS 7 is the real security hero this week! 💪
✅ cURL too old for CVE-2023-38545
✅ glibc too old for CVE-2023-4911 / Looney Tunables
✅ httpd too old for CVE-2023-44487 or any HTTP/2 support

https://x.com/faker_/status/1712012931381047360

RE: https://dvd.chat/notes/9v6ojfjmqcb212k1

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 13.34%

updated 2024-03-29T18:30:50

2 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. The tarballs included extra .m4 files, which contained instructions for building with automake that did not exist in the repository. These instructions, through a series of complex obfuscations, extract a prebuilt object file from one of the test archives, which is then used to modify specific functions in t

Nuclei template

decio at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.051Z ##

Résumé de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impacté ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.7p1-7.
⬇️
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions inférieures à 5.6.1-r2
    ⬇️
    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 9.8p1-1.
    ⬇️
    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.
    ⬇️
    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 7 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 8 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnérables (correctif en cours de préparation).
    ⬇️
    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.
    ⬇️
    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat
⬇️
"Ce problème peut être résolu en définissant le paramètre LoginGraceTime à 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramètre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redémarrez le démon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnérable aux attaques par déni de service en raison de la possibilité d'épuisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protégé contre les éventuelles attaques par exécution de code à distance."

Bon résumé en FR
👇
https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connectés" exposés ça va être dur, dur…

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_6387

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-02T08:01:53.000Z ##

Résumé de l'impact de la vuln CVE-2024-6387 par distribution :linux:

  • Debian :debian: :

Debian 11 : non impacté ;
Debian 12 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.2p1-deb12u3 ;
Debian SID : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.7p1-7.
⬇️
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

  • Alpine Linux Edge :alpinelinux: :
    xz-utils versions inférieures à 5.6.1-r2
    ⬇️
    https://security.alpinelinux.org/vuln/CVE-2024-3094

  • ArchLinux :archlinux: :
    Sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 9.8p1-1.
    ⬇️
    https://security.archlinux.org/ASA-202407-1

  • Oracle Linux :
    Oracle Linux 6 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 7 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 8 : non impacté ;
    Oracle Linux 9 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 8.7p1-38.0.2.el9.
    ⬇️
    https://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2024-12468.html

  • Red Hat :redhat: :
    RHEL 6 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 7 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 8 : non impacté ;
    RHEL 9 : toutes les versions sont vulnérables (correctif en cours de préparation).
    ⬇️
    https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-6387

  • Ubuntu :ubuntu: :
    Ubuntu 22.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.10 ;
    Ubuntu 23.10 :sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.3p1-1ubuntu3.6 ;
    Ubuntu 24.04 : sont vulnérables les versions OpenSSH inférieures strictement à 1:9.6p1-3ubuntu13.3.
    ⬇️
    https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-6859-1

Mitigation possible avec Fail2Ban & co et selon RedHat
⬇️
"Ce problème peut être résolu en définissant le paramètre LoginGraceTime à 0 dans le fichier de configuration de sshd.
1) En tant qu'utilisateur root, ouvrez le fichier /etc/ssh/sshd_config
2) Ajoutez ou modifiez la configuration du paramètre :
LoginGraceTime 0
3) Sauvegardez et fermez le fichier
4) Redémarrez le démon sshd :
systemctl restart sshd.service
Notez que le serveur sshd sera toujours vulnérable aux attaques par déni de service en raison de la possibilité d'épuisement des connexions MaxStartups, mais qu'il sera protégé contre les éventuelles attaques par exécution de code à distance."

Bon résumé en FR
👇
https://cyberwatch.fr/cve/cve-2024-6387-regresshion-detectez-et-corrigez-cette-vulnerabilite-sur-openssh/

Pour les "objets connectés" exposés ça va être dur, dur…

##

CVE-2024-0985
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-18T18:32:17

2 posts

Late privilege drop in REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW CONCURRENTLY in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the command issuer. The command intends to run SQL functions as the owner of the materialized view, enabling safe refresh of untrusted materialized views. The victim is a superuser or member of one of the attacker's roles. The attack requires luring the victim

CVE-2023-4911
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.39%

updated 2024-03-02T05:06:50

1 posts

A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issue could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.

laozhoubuluo@dvd.chat at 2024-07-01T15:42:09.312Z ##

回顾去年，CentOS 7 在一周内发布的三个漏洞中都因为所带组件版本较低不受新版本组件漏洞影响而幸免遇难。

CentOS 7 is the real security hero this week! 💪
✅ cURL too old for CVE-2023-38545
✅ glibc too old for CVE-2023-4911 / Looney Tunables
✅ httpd too old for CVE-2023-44487 or any HTTP/2 support

https://x.com/faker_/status/1712012931381047360

RE: https://dvd.chat/notes/9v6ojfjmqcb212k1

updated 2024-02-25T05:08:04

2 posts

IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside a quoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator has installed files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, an attacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap superuser.

CVE-2024-21626
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.06%

updated 2024-02-20T19:26:11

2 posts

### Impact In runc 1.1.11 and earlier, due to an internal file descriptor leak, an attacker could cause a newly-spawned container process (from `runc exec`) to have a working directory in the host filesystem namespace, allowing for a container escape by giving access to the host filesystem ("attack 2"). The same attack could be used by a malicious image to allow a container process to gain access

1 repos

#search_error

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-06-28T18:06:47.000Z ##

This article discusses a vulnerability in all versions of runc <=1.1.11, as used by the Docker engine, along with other containerization technologies such as Kubernetes, that can result in container escape to the underlying host OS

➜ https://dev.to/snyk/vulnerability-runc-processcwd-and-leaked-fds-container-breakout-cve-2024-21626-2oko

CVE-2024-23651
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-09T01:43:51.767000

1 posts

BuildKit is a toolkit for converting source code to build artifacts in an efficient, expressive and repeatable manner. Two malicious build steps running in parallel sharing the same cache mounts with subpaths could cause a race condition that can lead to files from the host system being accessible to the build container. The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5. Workarounds include, avoiding using Buil

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-06-27T18:06:05.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability in all versions of Docker Buildkit <=v0.12.4 that can result in container escape to the underlying host OS when building an image using a malicious Dockerfile or upstream image (i.e. when using `FROM`)

➜ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-mount-cache-race-build-time-race-condition-container-breakout-cve-2024-23651-7k0

(8.8 HIGH)

updated 2024-02-03T05:07:00

2 posts

A flaw was found in PostgreSQL that allows authenticated database users to execute arbitrary code through missing overflow checks during SQL array value modification. This issue exists due to an integer overflow during array modification where a remote user can trigger the overflow by providing specially crafted data. This enables the execution of arbitrary code on the target system, allowing user

##

CVE-2024-23652
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-01T17:48:28

1 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

1 repos

https://github.com/abian2/CVE-2024-23652

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-06-26T18:05:08.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-23652) in Docker Buildkit = v0.12.4, which allows arbitrary file deletion in the host OS

Mitigation involves updating to Buildkit v0.12.5 or later

➜ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-build-time-container-teardown-arbitrary-delete-cve-2024-23652-2kkh

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T22:54:56.844Z ##

GreyNoise: Perma-Vuln: D-Link DIR-859, CVE-2024-0769
D-Link is the gift that keeps on giving: GreyNoise reports that CVE-2024-0769 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 January 2024) D-Link DIR-859 WiFi router path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) to information disclosure vulnerability is being exploited in the wild (cc: @todb):

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

#CVE_2024_0769 #Dlink #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T22:54:56.000Z ##

GreyNoise: Perma-Vuln: D-Link DIR-859, CVE-2024-0769
D-Link is the gift that keeps on giving: GreyNoise reports that CVE-2024-0769 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 January 2024) D-Link DIR-859 WiFi router path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) to information disclosure vulnerability is being exploited in the wild (cc: @todb):

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

#CVE_2024_0769 #Dlink #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.408Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.000Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

Fortinet: MerkSpy: Exploiting CVE-2021-40444 to Infiltrate Systems
Fortinet reports on a new Windows spyware dubbed MerkSpy, whose infection chain leverages CVE-2021-40444 (7.8 high, disclosed 07 September 2021, added to CISA KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft MSHTML Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. MerkSpy is capable of keystroke logging, screenshot capture, and harvesting Chrome browser login data. Fortinet describes the attack chain and provides IOC.

#threatintel #merkspy #ioc #CVE_2021_40444

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2023-11-04T00:30:22

2 posts

urllib3 doesn't treat the `Cookie` HTTP header special or provide any helpers for managing cookies over HTTP, that is the responsibility of the user. However, it is possible for a user to specify a `Cookie` header and unknowingly leak information via HTTP redirects to a different origin if that user doesn't disable redirects explicitly. Users **must** handle redirects themselves instead of relyin

updated 2023-09-18T05:03:19

2 posts

A certain 5400 RPM OEM hard drive, as shipped with laptop PCs in approximately 2005, allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (device malfunction and system crash) via a resonant-frequency attack with the audio signal from the Rhythm Nation music video.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.822Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

#threatintel #8220gang #WaterSigbin #cybercrime #cryptomining #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##

CVE-2017-10271
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.41%

updated 2023-02-02T05:00:43

4 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: WLS Security). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.1.0 and 12.2.1.2.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of

Nuclei template

##

CVE-2006-5051(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 79.14%

updated 2023-02-01T05:01:22

14 posts

Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code if GSSAPI authentication is enabled, via unspecified vectors that lead to a double-free.

1 repos

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-6387

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-01T16:45:06.000Z ##

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

｢ They have named this vulnerability "regreSSHion", since it represents the re-emergence of a bug that was previously patched in 2006 (CVE-2006-5051). It is described as "critical" ｣

#OpenSSH #regreSSHion #CVE20065051 #SSH #Vulnerability #Infosec #Opensource
https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4329906/critical-vulnerability-openssh-uncovered-affects-linux-systems

cyberkillen@swecyb.com at 2024-07-02T05:11:48.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T13:38:08.837Z ##

OpenSSH security advisory: regreSSHion: RCE in OpenSSH's server, on glibc-based Linux systems (CVE-2024-6387)
CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

##
briankrebs at 2024-07-01T12:31:54.923Z ##

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

##
decio at 2024-07-01T09:44:57.496Z ##

But that's not like me, I'm breaking free
-- The Interrupters, "Haven't Seen the Last of Me" 😁

"This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems,
where syslog() itself calls async-signal-unsafe functions (for example,
malloc() and free()): an unauthenticated remote code execution as root,
because it affects sshd's privileged code, which is not sandboxed and
runs with full privileges. We have not investigated any other libc or
operating system; but OpenBSD is notably not vulnerable, because its
SIGALRM handler calls syslog_r(), an async-signal-safer version of
syslog() that was invented by OpenBSD in 2001.

To exploit this vulnerability remotely (to the best of our knowledge,
CVE-2006-5051 has never been successfully exploited before), we drew
inspiration from a visionary paper, "Delivering Signals for Fun and
Profit", which was published in 2001 by Michal Zalewski"
👇
https://www.qualys.com/2024/07/01/cve-2024-6387/regresshion.txt

#Debian :debian: tracker
👇
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

#CyberVeille #cve_2024_6387

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-07-01T09:40:22.124Z ##

regreSSHion: Remote Code Execution in OpenSSH Server (CVE-2024-6387)

Date: July 1, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-6387

Vulnerability Type: Race Condition

CWE: [[CWE-362]], [[CWE-665]]

Sources: Qualys

Synopsis

A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been identified in OpenSSH's server on glibc-based Linux systems, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, is a regression of a previously patched issue (CVE-2006-5051) and affects OpenSSH versions from 8.5p1 to 9.8p1. It arises from a signal handler race condition in the sshd server, leading to unsafe function calls within asynchronous signal handlers.

Technical Key Findings

The flaw involves sshd's SIGALRM handler, which calls non-async-signal-safe functions like syslog(), potentially leading to a heap corruption and enabling remote code execution. The exploit requires precise timing to interrupt specific code paths, leaving the system in an inconsistent state that can be exploited.

Vulnerable Products

  • OpenSSH versions 8.5p1 to 9.8p1 on glibc-based Linux systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root on affected systems, potentially leading to complete system compromise.

Patches or Workaround

A fix has been implemented in OpenSSH by moving the async-signal-unsafe code to a synchronous context. Users are advised to update to the latest version or set LoginGraceTime to 0 as a temporary mitigation.

Tags

#OpenSSH #CVE-2024-6387 #RCE #RaceCondition #Linux #glibc #SecurityVulnerability #Exploit #Patch

##
cyberkillen@swecyb.com at 2024-07-02T05:11:48.000Z ##

(CVE-2006-5051) #regresshion

CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

##
briankrebs@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T12:31:54.000Z ##

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

"This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems,
where syslog() itself calls async-signal-unsafe functions (for example,
malloc() and free()): an unauthenticated remote code execution as root,
because it affects sshd's privileged code, which is not sandboxed and
runs with full privileges. We have not investigated any other libc or
operating system; but OpenBSD is notably not vulnerable, because its
SIGALRM handler calls syslog_r(), an async-signal-safer version of
syslog() that was invented by OpenBSD in 2001.

To exploit this vulnerability remotely (to the best of our knowledge,
CVE-2006-5051 has never been successfully exploited before), we drew
inspiration from a visionary paper, "Delivering Signals for Fun and

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T09:40:22.000Z ##

regreSSHion: Remote Code Execution in OpenSSH Server (CVE-2024-6387)

Date: July 1, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-6387

Vulnerability Type: Race Condition

CWE: [[CWE-362]], [[CWE-665]]

Sources: Qualys

Synopsis

A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been identified in OpenSSH's server on glibc-based Linux systems, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, is a regression of a previously patched issue (CVE-2006-5051) and affects OpenSSH versions from 8.5p1 to 9.8p1. It arises from a signal handler race condition in the sshd server, leading to unsafe function calls within asynchronous signal handlers.

Technical Key Findings

The flaw involves sshd's SIGALRM handler, which calls non-async-signal-safe functions like syslog(), potentially leading to a heap corruption and enabling remote code execution. The exploit requires precise timing to interrupt specific code paths, leaving the system in an inconsistent state that can be exploited.

Vulnerable Products

  • OpenSSH versions 8.5p1 to 9.8p1 on glibc-based Linux systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root on affected systems, potentially leading to complete system compromise.

Patches or Workaround

A fix has been implemented in OpenSSH by moving the async-signal-unsafe code to a synchronous context. Users are advised to update to the latest version or set LoginGraceTime to 0 as a temporary mitigation.

Buffer overflow in login in various System V based operating systems allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a large number of arguments through services such as telnet and rlogin.

CVE-2007-1667(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 6.91%

updated 2023-01-31T05:03:54

1 posts

Multiple integer overflows in (1) the XGetPixel function in ImUtil.c in X.Org libx11 before 1.0.3, and (2) XInitImage function in xwd.c for ImageMagick, allow user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or obtain sensitive information via crafted images with large or negative values that trigger a buffer overflow.

janl@narrativ.es at 2024-06-26T16:37:25.000Z ##

It’s not fair because I’ve only done a handful and my colleagues sent literally dozens of CVE clarifications to NIST, but one of mine got published already: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1667#VulnChangeHistorySection

Background level 1: we are currently triaging old and new CVEs for correctness for Yocto specifically, but this being Linux packages, they will benefit all distros.

Background level 2: ImageMagick was listed as vulnerable because it *uses* libx11, but it does not *vend* it nor does it specifies safe versions.

The Windows Graphical Device Interface library (GDI32.DLL) in Microsoft Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a Windows Metafile (WMF) format image with a crafted SETABORTPROC GDI Escape function call, related to the Windows Picture and Fax Viewer (SHIMGVW.DLL), a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2123 and CVE-2005-2124, and as originally discovered in the wild on union

##

CVE-2021-30561(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2023-01-30T05:01:13

4 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."

CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-02T20:00:03.000Z ##

💣 CVE-2024-29510 - Exploiting Ghostscript using format strings
ᐅ Codean Labs

｢ This vulnerability has significant impact on web-applications and other services offering document conversion and preview functionalities as these often use Ghostscript under the hood. We recommend verifying whether your solution (indirectly) makes use of Ghostscript and if so, update it to the latest version ｣

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-29510-ghostscript-format-string-exploitation/

#Ghostscript #Vulnerability #Infosec #Opensource #CVE #CVE202429510

screaminggoat at 2024-07-02T13:39:39.844Z ##

SecureLayer7: Major Security Flaws in Mailcow: Inside the XSS and Path Traversal Exploits (CVE-2024-31204 and CVE-2024-30270)
Mailcow is an open source mail server software suite. CVE-2024-31204 (6.1 medium) XSS in the Admin Panel and CVE-2024-30270 (6.2 medium) arbitrary file overwrite were originally reported by SonarSource. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to provide a root cause analysis (proof of concept) for them.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_31204 #CVE_2024_30270 #mailcow #proofofconcept #CVE

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.760Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—July 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

Google Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—July 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

CVE-2024-37282
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:04:49.398Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.2 Security Update (ESA-2024-18)
CVE-2024-37282 (8.1 high) ECE Improper Authorization. It was identified that under certain specific preconditions, an API key 2 that was originally created with a specific privileges could be subsequently used to create new API keys that have elevated privileges.

Affected ECE versions after 3.0.0 and before 3.7.2. Users should upgrade to version 3.7.2. No mention of exploitation

#CVE_2024_37282 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T14:32:07.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds 3 to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2022-24816 (9.8 criutical) GeoSolutionsGroup JAI-EXT Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-2586 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-13965 (6.1 medium) Roundcube Webmail Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
